messages: 633fd42200730d3f685abc0a248a1647 (15:12): I have a layout with three columns, fixed left and right (with float: and clear:), and a dynamic center
633fd42200730d3f685abc0a248a1647 (15:13): in the center column, I'd like to float some items. when I do a clear:, it puts it below the 'outer' columns
633fd42200730d3f685abc0a248a1647 (15:13): should I not be doing a clear here?
633fd42200730d3f685abc0a248a1647 (15:13): if so, how do I vertically stack several floated items in the center column?
633fd42200730d3f685abc0a248a1647 (15:15): can I build a div in the center column that essentially hides knowledge of clear: from outside?
42d6c5f931e29a47ba58bd6531b21cb8 (15:30): no way for positioning the image added with list-type-image ?
1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (15:30): hi, i have a class definition "#events li:first-line", when it exists (even if empty) all the hebrew text in #events goes from rtl to ltr. any idea why?
42d6c5f931e29a47ba58bd6531b21cb8 (15:30): or do I have to attach it as a bg?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (15:33): phretor: use background images, it's more reliable across browsers
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (15:33): ailaG: sounds like a bug in your browser
1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (15:33): anything i write under #events and #events li:first-line etc works except the rtl thing
42d6c5f931e29a47ba58bd6531b21cb8 (15:35): how do you feel when you just finished to design your last website and IE is right there in the corner? Waiting for you to debug the site with it? :-)
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (15:36): I keep track of IE as I'm building, if it's a site that needs to work in IE :p
1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (15:38): thanks, already there. havent found a bug report, submitting one

1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (15:58): oooooookay, update on my rtl/first-line problem: when the CSS is within the file the outcome is okay! when the css is at <link rel=stylesheet type=text/css href=hum.css />  the rtl turns to ltr on items that have :first-line
62b511e80e6c9a88985f75c7bf6bac66 (16:05): Where within your HTML do you have your link tag?
62b511e80e6c9a88985f75c7bf6bac66 (16:06): You can copy and paste your HTML source here: (http://validator.w3.org/) and it will alert you if it's in the wrong spot.
1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (16:09): i have html - title - meta tag that defines encoding - our link rel tag - body dir=rtl. validating..
1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (16:22): OK, now the top part validates.. and still doesnt work
62b511e80e6c9a88985f75c7bf6bac66 (16:23): I don't know then, strange indeed
1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (16:27): beh, making a page valid gets frustrating. and why does w3c order NOT to close <link> tags?
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (16:28): ailaG why would they need a closing tag?
62b511e80e6c9a88985f75c7bf6bac66 (16:31): Ending a tag with a forward slash is the equivalent of closing it anyways I thought.
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (16:33): it's not equivalent, but it's used in xml if a closing tag isnt allowed
1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (16:37): yea, but the link tag is only <link blah blah>. it should be <link blah blah /> yet that produces a validation error
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (16:39): no it doesn't, youre probably using a html doctype?
1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (16:42): i just copied it off from a page that validated. what should i use then?
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (16:42): no the dtd link never closes
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (16:42): you can use that one... i usually stick with <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd">
1fdd6c692157f97b87f51e3f3b8b8acd (16:48): ok, solved the first-line problem .. sort of.. i entered another tag so that the text won't be a direct child of "li", and "li" had the first-line attribute
9cd4cee30e420f4a7425dbd1eaa09af3 (16:53): how can i make a link sub class ?
9cd4cee30e420f4a7425dbd1eaa09af3 (16:54): i want to use my default classes
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (16:55): You can put more than one class on an item
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (16:55): HeliosTech you can assign several classes to an element, <foo class="class1 class2">
9c3120441d3b17ef13f2e08e9fdeafea (17:27): how do I get my #column to wind up in the same place on both pages?
9c3120441d3b17ef13f2e08e9fdeafea (17:27): *and* make it go all the way to the bottom in both browsers
